content.title: Rajiv Gandhi Gramin Bhoomihin Krishi Majdoor Nyay Yojana
content.details: The objective of the scheme is to identify landless agricultural laborer families in Gram Panchayat and Nagar Panchayat and provide financial grants to landless agricultural laborer families on an annual basis. It aims to increase the net income of landless agricultural labor families through financial grants.
benefits: Under the scheme, an amount of Rs.7000/- per year will be provided as a grant-in-aid in installments to the head of the eligible identified beneficiary family.
The grant-in-aid amount will be made by Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) directly into the bank account of the head of the identified empaneled household.
eligibility: Landless agricultural laborer families residing in Gram Panchayat and Nagar Panchayat areas.
Families such as shepherds, carpenters, blacksmiths, cobblers, barbers, washermen, priests, and forest produce collectors without agricultural land are eligible.

Persons known by the names of Pujari / Baiga / Guniya / Manjhi etc. Baja Moharia will be eligible despite holding agricultural land, but those receiving financial assistance from other government schemes will not be eligible.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. Beneficiaries must register on the portal of Rajiv Gandhi Rural Landless Agricultural Laborer Justice Scheme, attach required documents, and submit the application to the Gram Panchayat Secretary.

faqs.question: What are the Rajiv Gandhi Gramin Bhoomihin Krishi Majdoor Nyay Yojana?
faqs.answer: Provide financial grants to landless agricultural laborer families on an annual basis.

faqs.question: What are the benefits?
faqs.answer: Amount of Rs.7000/- per year will be provided to the head of the eligible identified beneficiary family.

faqs.question: Who can avail the benefits of the scheme?
What is the eligibility Criteria?
faqs.answer: 1. Original residents of Chhattisgarh. 2. Landless agricultural laborer families. 3. Shepherds, carpenters, blacksmiths, cobblers, barbers, washermen, priest families associated with Pauni - Pasari system, forest produce collectors, and other categories will also be eligible.

faqs.question: Can Other State person also apply for this scheme?
By which mode applicants can apply?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply Online mode and offline mode.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme through online methods?
faqs.answer: 1. First of all, the beneficiary will have to register on the portal of the Rajiv Gandhi Rural Landless Agricultural Laborer Justice Scheme to avail the benefits. 2. Upload all the required documents and submit them.

faqs.question: How To Apply For The Scheme Through Offline Methods?
faqs.answer: 1. Download the application forms. 2. Fill out all the details. 3. Attach all the required documents. 4. Submit the application form with documents to the Secretary Gram Panchayat in Gram Panchayat areas and Chief Municipal Officer Nagar Panchayat in Nagar Panchayat areas.

faqs.question: What document needs to submit?
faqs.answer: 1. Aadhar card. 2. Photo. 3. Mobile number. 4. Permanent residence certificate. 5. Bank Passbook.

faqs.question: How to download the application form?
faqs.answer: 1. General Application Form link: https://rggbkmny.cg.nic.in/downloads/Rggbkmny_Form.pdf 2. Application form for priest / Baiga / Guniya / Manjhi / Haat Paharia / Baja Mahoria of the scheduled area: https://rggbkmny.cg.nic.in/downloads/RGGBKMNY_Baiga_Form.pdf
